title: EUROCONTROL Maps
text: Let’s plot Italian FIR FL300  UK, things complicated also Oceanic bit volume  plot continental part need split things:
code: plot_country_fir("LI", "Italy", fl = 300) plot_country_fir("EG", "UK (oceanic)", fl = 200) uk_continental <- firs_nm_406 %>%   dplyr::filter(icao == "EG", min_fl <= 0, 0 <= max_fl) %>%   dplyr::filter(!(code %in% c("EGGXFIR", "EGGX"))) plot_country_fir(   "EG",   "UK (continental)",   firs = uk_continental,   fl = 200)

title: EUROCONTROL Maps
code: # some airports apts <- tibble::tribble(    ~ICAO_CODE, ~IATA_CODE,               ~LON,    ~LAT,           ~NAME,        "EDDF",      "FRA",   8.5706, 50.0333,               "Frankfurt",        "EHAM",      "AMS",   4.7642, 52.3080,               "Amsterdam",        "LFPG",      "CDG",   2.5478, 49.0097, "Paris/Charles-De-Gaulle",        "EGLL",      "LHR", -0.46139, 51.4775,         "London/Heathrow"    )  # transform to sf apts_sf <- apts %>%    st_as_sf(coords = c("LON", "LAT"), crs = 4326)  # keep only EGLL apt <- apts_sf %>%       filter(ICAO_CODE == "EGLL")   # single country (FIR) uk_continental <- firs_nm_406 %>%    dplyr::filter(icao == "EG", min_fl <= 0, 0 <= max_fl) %>%    dplyr::filter(!(id %in% c("EGGXFIR", "EGGX")))  bbox <- uk_continental %>%    st_transform(crs = sf::st_crs(3035)) %>%    st_bbox()  plot_country_fir(   "EG",   "UK (continental)",   firs = uk_continental,   fl = 200) +   ggplot2::geom_sf(     data = apt,     shape = 10,     size = 3) +   ggplot2::geom_sf_text(     data = apt,     aes(label = ICAO_CODE),     vjust = -0.5) +   # (re-)zoom to the correct bounding box   ggplot2::coord_sf(xlim = bbox[c(1, 3)], ylim = bbox[c(2, 4)]) +   # (re-)define the title and subtitle (`plot_country_fir()` adds its own)   ggtitle(label = str_glue("{name} ({icao})", name = apt$NAME, icao = apt$ICAO_CODE),           subtitle = "United Kingdom FIR (continental) at FL200")

title: EUROCONTROL Maps
text: plotting EUROCONTROL Member States’ FIR area can select merge various airspaces:

title: EUROCONTROL Maps
code: ms_codes <- member_states %>%    # filter out Germany (military, no specific FIR),   #   Luxembourg (managed by Belgium) and Monaco (managed by France)   filter(!icao %in% c("ET", "EL", "LN")) %>%    distinct(icao) %>%   pull(icao)   ms_firs <- ms_codes %>%    purrr::map_dfr(~ suppressMessages(     country_fir(pruatlas::firs_nm_406, icao_id = .x))) %>%    mutate(id = str_sub(id, 1, 2)) %>%   left_join(member_states %>%               filter(!icao %in% c("ET", "EL", "LN")) %>%               distinct(icao, .keep_all = TRUE),             by = c("id" = "icao")) %>%    mutate(     name = case_when(       id == "EB" ~ "Belgium and Luxemburg",       id == "LF" ~ "France and Monaco",       id == "LY" ~ "Serbia and Montenegro",       id == "EG" ~ "United Kingdom",       TRUE       ~ name),     icao = id,     min_fl = 200,     max_fl = 200)  plot_country_fir(firs = ms_firs,                  icao_id = ms_codes,                  fl = 200,                  name = "EUROCONTROL",                  merge = FALSE)

title: EUROCONTROL Maps
text: can get CRCO charging zones boundaries EUROCONTROL web site. package stores real file example.
code: bo <- system.file("extdata", "sbm_bz_20200527.txt", package = "pruatlas") crco <- readr::read_lines(bo) %>%   parse_airspace_crco() %>%    mutate(icao = unit) codes <- crco %>% pull(icao) %>% unique()  plot_country_fir(firs = crco,                  fl = 200,                  icao_id = codes,                  name = "CRCO charging zones",                  merge = FALSE)

EUROCONTROL Maps
text: st_segmentize improved things still BAD!
code: firs <- system.file("extdata", "icao_firs.geojson", package = "pruatlas") %>%    read_sf() %>%    rename(icao = icao_code) north_atlantic() %>%    sf::st_segmentize(dfMaxLength = units::set_units(50, km)) %>%    plot_country_fir(icao_id = "NOAT",                    name = "STATFOR North Atlantic",                    firs = .)

title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {pruatlas: The Atlas and Utilities for PRU Maps},   author = {Enrico Spinielli},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.3.4},   url = {https://pruatlas.ansperformance.eu}, }

what: The Atlas and Utilities for PRU Maps
title: The Atlas and Utilities for PRU Maps
text: still Work Progress value constructive feedback: please check issues page eventually file bug feature request. pruatlas package provides helpers generating maps interest PRU publications. high low level facilities. example high level helper, code plotting map Germany country FIR ANSP follows:  EUROCONTROL’s Member States FIR area:  Lower level functions datasets include example countries50m, Simple Feature whole world countries extent_fir() calculate bounding box country FIR. Useful functions : plot_country_fir() plot_country_ansp() package contains following aviation GIS datasets (CFMU AIRAC 406, see ): firs_nm_406: FIR’s defined/used EUROCONTROL’s Network Manager ansps_ace_406: ANSP’s defined/used ACE Benchmarking Report (CFMU) AIRAC 406, .k.. AIRAC 1512, spans 28-day interval 2015-11-12 UTC–2015-12-10 UTC. need polygons different AIRAC’s one package access EUROCONTROL DB, can look scripts data-raw directory. example export_nm_fir_geojson.R export_ace_ansp_geojson.R allow exporting FIR’s ANSP’s GeoJSON can read {sf} features via sf::read_sf().
code: library(sf) library(pruatlas) fl <- 300 plot_country_fir("ED", "Germany", fl = fl) plot_country_ansp("DFS", "DFS, Germany", fl = fl) ms <- "BI|E.|L.|UD|UG|GM|UK|GC" plot_country_fir(icao_id = ms, "EUROCONTROL Member States", buffer = 350, fl = 200)

title: The Atlas and Utilities for PRU Maps
text: Pruatlas still early development available GitHub. relies uses functionality sf package relies working installation GDAL, see sf installation instructions directions. order install pruatlas need run:

title: The Atlas and Utilities for PRU Maps
text: implement similar facilities FIR’s/ANSP’s Elementaty Sectors (ES’s) order able plot single ES ACC’s include export_<airspace_type> package API rather scripts package datasets extract style plot functions make better theme extend Member States dataset

title: The Atlas and Utilities for PRU Maps
text: order build relevant pkgdown web pages, execute following code:
code: # How to build the pkgdown from behind proxied Internet library(withr) library(pkgdown)  with_options(list(pkgdown.internet = FALSE),              build_site())

title: Extract ANSP polygon at defined flight level — country_ansp
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ country_ansp(ansps_ace_406, "DFS", fl = 350)  # more complicated for Italy/ENAV: there is a hole over Rome. # if we want to get rid of it we can use smoothr::fill_holes() enav <- pruatlas::ansps_ace_406 %>%   country_ansp(ansp_id = "ENAV", fl = 355) %>%   smoothr::fill_holes(units::set_units(10000, km^2)) } # }

title: Return the country FIR for a EUROCONTROL's Member State. — country_fir
text: firs relevant NM FIRs. icao_id optional, ICAO ID relevant country, "LI" otherwise. can regular expression, .e. "LI|LF" matching France Italy. fl flight level assemble composing polygons. merge want merge? (Default: TRUE). exclude List IDs filter . can useful use continental portion FIR interest, .e. exclude SANTA MARIA FIR Portugal.

title: Return the country FIR for a EUROCONTROL's Member State. — country_fir
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # France country_fir(pruatlas::firs_nm_406, "LF") # EUROCONTROL's Member States country_fir(pruatlas::firs_nm_406, icao_id = "E.|L.|UD|UG|GM|UK|GC") # Consider only continental portion of Portugal FIR country_fir(pruatlas::firs_nm_406, icao_id = "LP", exclude = c("LPPOFIR")) } # }

title: EUROCONTROL's Member States — member_states
text: data frame following fields name country name, e.g. "Italy" iso3c 3-letter ISO code, e.g. "ITA" iso2c 2-letter ISO code, e.g. "" icao 2-letter ICAO code, e.g. "LI" iso3n 3-digits ISO code, e.g. "380" date date status code, e.g. 1996-04-01 status status code, e.g. "M" (M Member State, C Comprehensive Agreement State, T Transitional State) useful grab right spatial polygons case need. Note: Kosovo also included list.

what: Parse CRCO Airspace Charging Zone format — parse_airspace_crco
title: Parse CRCO Airspace Charging Zone format — parse_airspace_crco
text: parse_airspace_crco reads airspace CRCO format returns tibble row describes airspace. airspace file can found EUROCONTROL website. airspace CRCO format described : Airspace description (one row): nb_point number points latitude latitude (label) longitude longitude (label) flights bottom_level low level volume (flight level) top_level high level volume (flight level) surface sector_num flight time traffic density x mileage rte extens. value 1 value 2 name airspace name/code latitude longitude: coordinates (nb_point rows minutes decimal)

title: Parse CRCO Airspace Charging Zone format — parse_airspace_crco
Parse CRCO Airspace Charging Zone format — parse_airspace_crco
text: lines text lines PRISME airspace representation

title: Parse CRCO Airspace Charging Zone format — parse_airspace_crco
text: tibble airspaces (CRS = 4326)

text: ansp_id optional, ANSP ID relevant country, "ENAV" otherwise. can regular expression, .e. "DFS|ENAV" matching Germany Italy. name name used title plot. fl flight level interest buffer Buffer around ANSP (km) ansps sf holding ANSP polygons, .e. pruatlas::ansps_ace_406

title: Plot country and relevant ANSP. — plot_country_ansp
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ plot_country_ansp("DFS", "Germany") # Italy'ENAV has a hole above Rome... plot_country_ansp("ENAV", "Italy (hole over Rome)") # ...filling the hole, manually enav <- pruatlas::ansps_ace_406 %>%   country_ansp(ansp_id = "ENAV", fl = 355) %>%   dplyr::mutate(min_fl = 355, max_fl = 355, id = "ENAV") %>%   smoothr::fill_holes(units::set_units(10000, km^2)) plot_country_ansp(ansp_id = "ENAV", name = "Italy", fl = 355, ansps = enav) } # }
